summary: A confidential letter to Judge Alison J. Nathan from an unnamed individual petitioning for the release of Ghislaine Maxwell on bail. The writer offers $2,000 as security, vouches for Maxwell's character, and argues that her conditions of confinement are extreme and that she will not flee.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, to whom this letter is addressed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the letter, for whom the writer is petitioning the court to release on bail, asserting her innocence and good character.

connections.description: The writer describes being close to Maxwell, having lunch with her, and communicating a few times a year, indicating a personal friendship.

events.title: Bail Petition for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: An unnamed individual submits a letter to Judge Alison J. Nathan petitioning for the release of Ghislaine Maxwell on bail, offering $2,000 as security.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: An individual wrote to Judge Alison J. Nathan in November 2020 to petition for Ghislaine Maxwell's release on bail.
The writer offered $2,000 in cash as security towards Maxwell's bail bond.
The writer vouched for Maxwell's character, claimed she would not flee, and argued her conditions of confinement were extreme.
The writer asserts a personal friendship with Maxwell, having lunch with her and communicating several times a year.
The document is a confidential letter filed in support of Maxwell's bail application in case 20 Cr. 330 (AJN).
